activator.description: Use a custom activator to trigger the Chip option selector
activator.name: activator

autoSelectOnClickOutside.description:
If true, automatically selects an option based on the current search value when the input loses focus.
The automatic selection order is: an exact match of the search value if available, a custom option if
onCustomOptionSelect is provided, or the closest match.
autoSelectOnClickOutside.name: autoSelectOnClickOutside

onChange.description:
Callback whenever a chip is clicked. This returns a new value of
selected chips.
onChange.name: onChange

type.name: ((value?: string | undefined) => void) | ((value: string[]) => void) | ((value: string[]) => void)

onClick.name: onClick

type.name: ((event: MouseEvent<HTMLInputElement | HTMLButtonElement | HTMLDivElement, MouseEvent>, clickedChipValue?: string) => void)

onCustomAdd.description:
Callback when the user selects the custom option instead of the available
chips.

If not implemented, it won't allow custom add.
@param value
onCustomAdd.name: onCustomAdd

onLoadMore.name: onLoadMore

onlyShowMenuOnSearch.description: Control whether the menu only appears once the user types.
onlyShowMenuOnSearch.name: onlyShowMenuOnSearch

onSearch.name: onSearch

showSelectedSuffix.description:
Show the checkmark suffix on the selected Chip(s)
defaults to true
showSelectedSuffix.name: showSelectedSuffix

type.description: Change the interaction on the chip.
type.name: type
